item.title: Java Posse #302 - Roundup '10 - OO/Functional Hybrids
item.description:
Roundup '10 - Functional/OO hybrids and the Closing Session

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com
Recorded at the Java Posse Roundup 2010 in Crested Butte, CO. This podcasts consists of two sessions, a shorter 30 minute discussion about Object Oriented/Functional hybrid language adoption, and the closing session where almost all of the attendees introduce themselves (a handful had already left for flights).
  • Scala
    • http://scala-lang.org
  • BASE
    • http://svscala.ning.com
  • F#
    • http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/fsharp/
  • Clojure
    • http://clojure.org/
  • C#
    • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vcsharp/aa336809.aspx
  • Closures in Java 7
    • http://javac.info/
  • Javascript
    • http://www.javascript.com/
  • Function literals
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First-class_function
  • Immutability
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immutable_object
  • Ruby and Rails
    • http://rubyonrails.org/
  • Scaladoc
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/archives/beta-api/index.html
  • Introductions to Scala
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/node/104
    • http://jonasboner.com/2008/10/01/real-world-scala-introduction.html
  • Scala books
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/node/959
  • Lift website
    • http://liftweb.net/
  • Scala for the Busy Java developer - Ted Neward
    • http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-scala01228.html
  • Scala Swing
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/sid/8
  • Swing in Clojure
    • http://stuartsierra.com/2010/01/06/heating-up-clojure-swing
  • Actors for maintaining state
    • http://lambda-the-ultimate.org/node/3108
  • The Definitive Guide to JavaScript / JavaScript the Good Parts
    • http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0596000480/equal-20
    • http://ajaxian.com/archives/book-review-“javascript-the-good-parts”-by-crockford
  • Functional Koans
    • http://github.com/relevance/functional-koans/tree/scala
  • Ruby Koans
    • http://github.com/edgecase/ruby_koans
  • Cay Horstmann Functional Programming slides
    • http://www.horstmann.com/sjsu/cs152/schedule.html
  • Javabin scala-training-slides and scala-training-code on github
    • http://github.com/javabin/scala-training-slides
    • http://github.com/javabin/scala-training-code
Thanks
  • Libsyn.com - http://www.libsyn.com - for hosting and bandwidth
  • Feedburner.com - http://www.feedburner.com - for feed redirect
  • Kirsty Doherty, Amy Ehmann for Java Posse artwork
  • Theme Music:
    • Opening - "Java" the parody song Copyright 1997 Broken Records and Marjorie Music Publ. (BMI),
      • written and performed by Loose Bruce Kerr of the Dr. Demento Show and Sun Microsystems attorney.
      • Based on the WWI popular song, "Ja-da." Ukelele style on the recording taught to Bruce by his dad.
      • Re-produced with kind permission from "Loose" Bruce Kerr - http://loosebrucekerr.libsyn.com http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAX0gJt-aZg
    • Closing - Juan Carlos Jimenez - In the House (Intro No. 1)
  • To contact us:
    • Visit our homepage - http://javaposse.com
    • Post on our Google Group - http://groups.google.com/group/javaposse
    • Pose a question on our Google Moderator group - http://tinyurl.com/q4javaposse
    • Call us with questions and feedback - (408) 465-4626
    • Or send us email - javaposse@gmail.com


The Java Posse consists of Tor Norbye, Carl Quinn, Joe Nuxoll and Dick Wall

item.title: Java Posse #301 - Newscast for April 2nd 2010
item.description:
Newscast for April 2nd 2010

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com
Last chance - Javazone call for papers extended 1 week. http://jz10.java.no/program.html
  • Apple, Android, HTC, marketplaces and ex-CEOs.
    • http://www.apple.com/pr/library/2010/03/02patents.html
    • http://techcrunch.com/2010/03/02/apple-goes-after-htc-in-lawsuit-over-20-iphone-patents/
    • http://techcrunch.com/2010/03/02/the-complaint-apples-patent-lawsuit-against-htc-is-all-about-android/
    • http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE62H0EA20100318
    • http://java.dzone.com/dose/dzone-daily-dose-34
    • http://threatpost.com/en_us/blogs/htc-phones-pre-installed-mariposa-bot-client-030910
    • http://www.petitiononline.com/androidm/
    • http://www.ilounge.com/index.php/news/comments/eff-posts-apples-iphone-developer-agreement-online/
    • http://jonathanischwartz.wordpress.com/2010/03/09/good-artists-copy-great-artists-steal/
  • Tim Bray, co-editor of the XML specifications and former Sun director of web technologies, joins Google as developer advocate.
    • http://www.tbray.org/ongoing/When/201x/2010/03/15/Joining-Google
    • http://ruby.dzone.com/dose/dzone-daily-dose-316
  • Is Java.net going to Sonatype for infrastructure?
    • http://java.dzone.com/news/maven-studio-announced-oracle
    • http://weblogs.java.net/blog/fabriziogiudici/archive/2010/03/23/oracle-officially-asked-sonatype-back-javanet
    • http://weblogs.java.net/blog/kfarnham/archive/2010/03/23/no-formal-arrangementagreement-exists-between-javanet-and-sonatype
  • Miguel De Icaza speaks out against microsoft's handling of .NET, then the article mysteriously disappears (but Google still has it cached).
    • http://74.125.153.132/search?q=cache:http://www.sdtimes.com/link/34203&hl=en
    • http://www.itwire.com/opinion-and-analysis/open-sauce/37880-microsoft-has-shot-net-ecosystem-in-foot-de-icaza
    • http://java.dzone.com/dose/dzone-daily-dose-326
    • http://tirania.org/blog/archive/2010/Mar-25.html
  • Fallout from the Oracle acquisition of Sun continues, with Simon Phipps, former Sun open source officer, being elected to the OSI (Open Source Initiative) board of directors.
    • http://webmink.com/2010/03/08/sundown/
    • http://webmink.com/
    • http://java.dzone.com/dose/dzone-daily-dose-312
    • http://www.opensource.org/
    • http://www.infoworld.com/d/developer-world/java-pioneer-distances-himself-jcp-932
  • A quick mention: the large hadron collider in CERN has had its first successful run.
    • http://javaposse.com/index.php?post_id=347725
      http://lhc.web.cern.ch/lhc/

Quick News

  • The Eclipsecon e4-rover mars challenge winner was announced at EclipseCon last week.
    • http://ianskerrett.wordpress.com/2010/03/26/winners-of-the-e4-rover-mars-challenge/
    • http://recombu.com/news/iphone-app-developed-to-control-nasa-mars-robot_M11588.html
  • Amazon announced a new Java SDK for Amazon Web Services at EclipseCon.
    • http://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2010/03/22/announcing-the-aws-sdk-for-java/
  • DZone has a write up of the major news from EclipseCon.
    • http://eclipse.dzone.com/articles/eclipsecon-2010-report
  • 11 sessions from the Glassfish virtual conference are now available in podcast form.
    • http://blogs.sun.com/glassfishpodcast/
  • Primefaces, available for both JSF 1.0 and 2.0, has just been released open source under the Apache v2 license.
    • http://www.primefaces.org/
  • Google has launched the Google Apps Marketplace (not to be confused with the Android marketplace).
    • http://www.google.com/enterprise/marketplace/home
  • Aaron Houston has joined Adobe as the community manager for several of their user groups including Flex, Air and ColdFusion.
    • http://weblogs.java.net/blog/sunahouston/archive/2010/03/15/houston-go-adobe-ive-made-it-other-side
  • There may yet be hope for an improved Date and Time API for Java 7.
    • http://jcp.org/en/jsr/summary?id=310
    • http://www.theserverside.com/discussions/thread.tss?thread_id=59624
  • How to kill an OSGi project in 10 questions by Adam Bien.
    • http://java.dzone.com/articles/how-kill-osgi-project-10

ScalaWags

  • It looks like the first Scala Days event, to be held in Lausanne, Switzerland on April 15th and 16th is assured success.
    • http://days2010.scala-lang.org/node/132
    • http://days2010.scala-lang.org/program
  • The Scala team is organizing proposals for this year's Google summer of code.
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/node/5543
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/gsoc2010
  • And a Scala application of the week. Kojo is a Scala learning environment written using the NetBeans rich client platform.
    • http://netbeans.dzone.com/learn-scala-with-kojo

Groovy, Baby!

  • IndicThreads has more information about Groovy++.
    • http://www.indicthreads.com/7355/what-is-groovy-how-does-it-compare-with-java-and-groovy/

Listener Feedback

  • Buttons stop working on Linux, the truth revealed
    • https://bugs.launchpad.net/gtk/+bug/442078
  • PDF based replacement for Help
    • http://www.pdfhelp.org
  • HTTPCache4J
    • http://httpcache4j.codehaus.org/

Thanks

  • Libsyn.com - http://www.libsyn.com - for hosting and bandwidth
  • Feedburner.com - http://www.feedburner.com - for feed redirect
  • Kirsty Doherty, Amy Ehmann for Java Posse artwork
  • Theme Music:
    • Opening - "Java" the parody song Copyright 1997 Broken Records and Marjorie Music Publ. (BMI),
      • written and performed by Loose Bruce Kerr of the Dr. Demento Show and Sun Microsystems attorney.
      • Based on the WWI popular song, "Ja-da." Ukelele style on the recording taught to Bruce by his dad.
      • Re-produced with kind permission from "Loose" Bruce Kerr - http://loosebrucekerr.libsyn.com http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAX0gJt-aZg
    • Closing - Juan Carlos Jimenez - In the House (Intro No. 1)
  • To contact us:
    • Visit our homepage - http://javaposse.com
    • Post on our Google Group - http://groups.google.com/group/javaposse
    • Pose a question on our Google Moderator group - http://tinyurl.com/q4javaposse
    • Call us with questions and feedback - (408) 465-4626
    • Or send us email - javaposse@gmail.com


The Java Posse consists of Tor Norbye, Carl Quinn, Joe Nuxoll and Dick Wall

item.title: Java Posse #299 - Devoxx 09 - Project Lombok Interview
item.description:
Project Lombok Interview

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com
Preamble - alternative languages (and business) day at the Java Posse roundup. Meet 10am on Monday 15th at Rumors coffee and tea located in Blue Moon books. From there we will split off into groups and coding dojos.

This interview was recorded at Devoxx 2009 and is being released simultaneously as audio on the Java Posse, and in video form on Parleys. Check out parleys.com or look for the link in the shownotes to see the video version.

  • Lombok talk on Parleys
    • http://www.parleys.com/#id=74957&st=4
  • Video version of this talk
    • http://parleys.com/d/1881
  • The Project Lombok talk
    • http://parleys.com/d/1574
  • Project Lombok site
    • http://projectlombok.org/
  • Project Coin
    • http://openjdk.java.net/projects/coin/
  • BGGA  and java draft closures prototype/proposal
    • http://javac.info/
  • Joe Darcy blog post - annotation stub generation
    • http://blogs.sun.com/darcy/entry/properties_via_annotation_processing
  • De-lombok
    • http://projectlombok.org/features/delombok.html
  • IDE support - current state
    • Netbeans - http://wiki.netbeans.org/Lombok
    • IDEA - http://wiki.github.com/rzwitserloot/lombok/intellij-idea
  • @Data
    • http://projectlombok.org/features/Data.html
  • @Cleanup
    • http://projectlombok.org/features/Cleanup.html
  • All current Lombok features
    • http://projectlombok.org/features/index.html
  • Delegates (in .NET)
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegate_(.NET)
  • Mixins/Traits
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixins
  • About Reinier and Roel
    • http://projectlombok.org/credits.html
  • Tippits - tip jars on websites
    • http://tipit.to/
  • Topdesk - service management system
    • http://www.topdesk.com/en/home/

Thanks

  • Libsyn.com - http://www.libsyn.com - for hosting and bandwidth
  • Feedburner.com - http://www.feedburner.com - for feed redirect
  • Kirsty Doherty, Amy Ehmann for Java Posse artwork

      • written and performed by Loose Bruce Kerr of the Dr. Demento Show and Sun Microsystems attorney.
      • Based on the WWI popular song, "Ja-da." Ukelele style on the recording taught to Bruce by his dad.
      • Re-produced with kind permission from "Loose" Bruce Kerr - http://loosebrucekerr.libsyn.com http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAX0gJt-aZg
    • Closing - Juan Carlos Jimenez - In the House (Intro No. 1)

item.itunes:summary: Project Lombok Interview Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com Preamble - alternative languages (and business) day at the Java Posse roundup. Meet 10am on Monday 15th at Rumors coffee and tea located in Blue Moon books. From there we will split off into groups and coding dojos. This interview was recorded at Devoxx 2009 and is being released simultaneously as audio on the Java Posse, and in video form on Parleys. Check out parleys.com or look for the link in the shownotes to see the video version. Lombok talk on Parleys http://www.parleys.com/#id=74957&st=4 Video version of this talk http://parleys.com/d/1881 The Project Lombok talk http://parleys.com/d/1574 Project Lombok site http://projectlombok.org/ Project Coin http://openjdk.java.net/projects/coin/ BGGA  and java draft closures prototype/proposal http://javac.info/ Joe Darcy blog post - annotation stub generation http://blogs.sun.com/darcy/entry/properties_via_annotation_processing De-lombok http://projectlombok.org/features/delombok.html IDE support - current state Netbeans - http://wiki.netbeans.org/Lombok IDEA - http://wiki.github.com/rzwitserloot/lombok/intellij-idea @Data http://projectlombok.org/features/Data.html @Cleanup http://projectlombok.org/features/Cleanup.html All current Lombok features http://projectlombok.org/features/index.html Delegates (in .NET) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegate_(.NET) Mixins/Traits http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixins About Reinier and Roel http://projectlombok.org/credits.html Tippits - tip jars on websites http://tipit.to/ Topdesk - service management system http://www.topdesk.com/en/home/ Thanks Libsyn.com - http://www.libsyn.com - for hosting and bandwidth Feedburner.com - http://www.feedburner.com - for feed redirect Kirsty Doherty, Amy Ehmann for Java Posse artwork Theme Music: Opening - "Java" the parody song Copyright 1997 Broken Records and Marjorie Music Publ. (BMI), written and performed by Loose Bruce Kerr of the Dr. Demento Show and Sun Microsystems attorney. Based on the WWI popular song, "Ja-da." Ukelele style on the recording taught to Bruce by his dad. Re-produced with kind permission from "Loose" Bruce Kerr - http://loosebrucekerr.libsyn.com http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAX0gJt-aZg Closing - Juan Carlos Jimenez - In the House (Intro No. 1) To contact us: Visit our homepage - http://javaposse.com Post on our Google Group - http://groups.google.com/group/javaposse Pose a question on our Google Moderator group - http://tinyurl.com/q4javaposse Call us with questions and feedback - (408) 465-4626 Or send us email - javaposse@gmail.com The Java Posse consists of Tor Norbye, Carl Quinn, Joe Nuxoll and Dick Wall

item.title: Java Posse #298 - Newscast for Feb 25th 2010
item.description:
Newscast for Feb 25th 2010

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com
Please join us for the Java Posse Roundup 2010 in beautiful Crested Butte, CO. for an unconference of fantastic geek proportions.
To find out more:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/ To sign up:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/register.php And if you do sign up, please give us a little more information about yourself (like your T-shirt size - hint hint) at:
http://tinyurl.com/jproundup2010
  • Details begin to emerge about Oracle/Sun merging the JRockit and Sun Hotspot JVMs.
    • https://channelsun.sun.com/media/show/15028
    • http://www.infoworld.com/d/developer-world/oracle-set-merge-java-virtual-machines-935
    • http://www.oracle.com/technology/products/jrockit/missioncontrol/index.html
  •  NetBeans 6.9 Milestone 1
    • http://wiki.netbeans.org/NewAndNoteworthy69m1
    • http://wiki.netbeans.org/FitnessViaPostMortem
  • JavaOne call for papers is now open
    • http://blogs.sun.com/theaquarium/entry/javaone_2010_call_for_papers
    • http://java.dzone.com/announcements/javaone-call-papers
  • Application of the week - CrashPlan
    • http://crashplan.com

Quick News

  • JavaFX is seeing active duty in the Winter Olympics
    • http://terrencebarr.wordpress.com/2010/02/11/javafx-powers-vancouver-winter-olympics/

ScalaWags

  • With the approaching release of Scala 2.8, Lift is being updated as well.
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/node/5236
    • http://blog.lostlake.org/index.php?/archives/98-Back-in-the-Goat-Saddle.html

Listener Feedback

  • Java based multiplayer game server open sourced
    • Community site: www.cubeia.org
    • Corporate site: www.cubeia.com
    • More about Firebase: http://www.cubeia.com/index.php/products/firebase
    • Backgammon on Firebase: http://www.jadestone.se/index.php?page=backgammon
    • Mahjong on Firebase: http://www.mahjongexpress.com/
  • BioGroovy
    • http://biogroovy.open-bio.org
  • The TempoPosse
    • http://tempoposse.herod.net
  • Online backup suggestions:
    • http://www.backblaze.com/
    • http://www.crashplan.com/

Thanks

  • Libsyn.com - http://www.libsyn.com - for hosting and bandwidth
  • Feedburner.com - http://www.feedburner.com - for feed redirect
  • Kirsty Doherty, Amy Ehmann for Java Posse artwork
  • Theme Music:
    • Opening - "Java" the parody song Copyright 1997 Broken Records and Marjorie Music Publ. (BMI),
      • written and performed by Loose Bruce Kerr of the Dr. Demento Show and Sun Microsystems attorney.
      • Based on the WWI popular song, "Ja-da." Ukelele style on the recording taught to Bruce by his dad.
      • Re-produced with kind permission from "Loose" Bruce Kerr - http://loosebrucekerr.libsyn.com http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAX0gJt-aZg
    • Closing - Juan Carlos Jimenez - In the House (Intro No. 1)
  • To contact us:
    • Visit our homepage - http://javaposse.com
    • Post on our Google Group - http://groups.google.com/group/javaposse
    • Pose a question on our Google Moderator group - http://tinyurl.com/q4javaposse
    • Call us with questions and feedback - (408) 465-4626
    • Or send us email - javaposse@gmail.com

item.title: Java Posse #297 - Newscast for Feb 11th 2010
item.description:
Newscast for Feb 11th 2010

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com
Please join us for the Java Posse Roundup 2010 in beautiful Crested Butte, CO. for an unconference of fantastic geek proportions.
To find out more:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/

To sign up:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/register.php

And if you do sign up, please give us a little more information about yourself (like your T-shirt size - hint hint) at:
http://tinyurl.com/jproundup2010
  • Correction about Kenai going away - the kenai.com site is being closed, but the technology will be used on Java.net instead.
    • http://weblogs.java.net/blog/editor/archive/2010/02/08/
      kenaicom-infrastructure-will-be-coming-javanet
  • Oracle/Sun, more technical details on the Java product lines
    • http://oracle.com.edgesuite.net/ivt/4000/8104/9236/12627/
      lobby_external_flash_clean_480x360/default.htm
    • http://blogs.sun.com/jag/entry/so_long_old_friend
    • http://blogs.sun.com/theaquarium/entry/summary_of_post_oracle_changes
  • Amazon are releasing a development SDK for Kindle applications, starting with a limited Beta next month.
    • http://www.amazon.com/gp/feature.html/?ie=UTF8&docId=1000476231
    • http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2010-01/21/
      amazon-kindle-to-get-apps-and-games.aspx
  • Online/cloud storage
    • http://hunch.com/online-backup-services/
  • Google Buzz
    • http://www.google.com/buzz

Quick News

  • Developer.com has a guide to the new features in the recently released Spring 3.0.
    • http://www.developer.com/java/web/article.php/3861826/article.htm
  • Felipe Gaucho has a wrap-up from the recent JFokus in Stockholm, Sweden.
    • http://www.java.net/blog/felipegaucho/archive/2010/01/30/jfokus-2010-wrap
  • The Gnu compiler collection (gcc) steering committee has announced that it will support Google go from version 4.5 of gcc forwards.
    • http://java.dzone.com/dose/dzone-daily-dose-129
  • EclipseCon 2010.
    • http://www.eclipse.org/org/press-release/20100121_eclipsecon.php
  • Jazoon 2010.
    • http://weblogs.java.net/blog/fabriziogiudici/archive/2010/02/08/
      young-speakers-remember-jazoon-deadline-apr-4
  • Myriad claims that they have a higher performance Dalvik engine for Android devices.
    • http://www.myriadgroup.com/
  • Oracle has announced a large number of Oracle+Sun welcome event days to take place around the world in March and April of this year.
    • http://www.oracle.com/events/welcomesun/index.html#northamerica
  • Apache Ant 1.8 has been released.
    • http://ant.apache.org/
  • Apache Jackrabbit 2.0 has also been released.
    • http://www.apache.org/dist/jackrabbit/2.0.0/RELEASE-NOTES.txt
  • Flexycore's iSpectrum promises Java app development for the iPhone.
    • http://www.flexycore.com/en/products.html
  • Project Darkstar.
    • http://www.projectdarkstar.com/forum/?topic=1540.msg10397#msg10397
    • http://www.projectdarkstar.com/
    • http://github.com/Cyberqat/Red-Dwarf

ScalaWags

  • The first Scala 2.8 Beta is out.
    • http://www.scala-lang.org/node/4587
    • http://java.dzone.com/news/scala-28-improves-scala-ide

Groovy, Baby

  • DZone has an article about the best groovy modules you may not know about.
    • http://groovy.dzone.com/articles/best-groovy-projects-you-might

 

Listener Feedback

  • Android based competition
    • http://www.engadget.com/2010/01/29/
      michael-dell-pulls-mini-5-android-tablet-from-his-parka-offers/
    • http://www.itworld.com/personal-tech/94697/msi-ready-launch-ipad-alternative

Thanks

  • Libsyn.com - http://www.libsyn.com - for hosting and bandwidth
  • Feedburner.com - http://www.feedburner.com - for feed redirect
  • Kirsty Doherty, Amy Ehmann for Java Posse artwork
  • Theme Music:
    • Opening - "Java" the parody song Copyright 1997 Broken Records and Marjorie Music Publ. (BMI),
      • written and performed by Loose Bruce Kerr of the Dr. Demento Show and Sun Microsystems attorney.
      • Based on the WWI popular song, "Ja-da." Ukelele style on the recording taught to Bruce by his dad.
      • Re-produced with kind permission from "Loose" Bruce Kerr - http://loosebrucekerr.libsyn.com http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAX0gJt-aZg
    • Closing - Juan Carlos Jimenez - In the House (Intro No. 1)
  • To contact us:
    • Visit our homepage - http://javaposse.com
    • Post on our Google Group - http://groups.google.com/group/javaposse
    • Pose a question on our Google Moderator group - http://tinyurl.com/q4javaposse
    • Call us with questions and feedback - (408) 465-4626
    • Or send us email - javaposse@gmail.com

item.title: Java Posse #295 - Big News from Oracle/Sun and Apple
item.description:
Oracle/Sun and Apple announcements - 28th Jan 2009

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com
Java Posse Roundup - use your spring JavaOne budget! - last few days of the early bird pricing. Also be sure to sort out accommodation, etc.

To find out more:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/

To sign up:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/register.php

And if you do sign up, please give us a little more information about yourself (like your T-shirt size - hint hint) at:
http://tinyurl.com/jproundup2010


Only two news items for this one - the Sun/Oracle announcements, and the Apple iPad (not much Java in this part, so skip if you don't care).
  • JavaOne 2010
    • http://java.dzone.com/news/javaone-lives
  • The deal has closed
    • http://news.cnet.com/8301-30685_3-20000019-264.html
    • http://www.oracle.com/technology/community/sun-oracle-community-continuity.html
    • http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/g/a/2010/01/27/
      urnidgns852573C400693880002576B900002824.DTL
  • Apple iPad

item.description:
Newscast for January 21st 2010

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com

Please, join us for the Java Posse Roundup, March 16th to 19th in Crested Butte, CO, with a free JVM languages day on the 15th.

    • http://www.datanucleus.org/project/download.html

    • http://www.theserverside.com/news/thread.tss?thread_id=58985
    • http://javaposse.com/index.php?post_id=449043
  • SpringSource has also released version 1.0.0 GA of Spring Roo
    • http://www.springsource.org/roo
  • Google has released the final 1.0 version of the Google Collections Library
    • http://code.google.com/p/google-collections/

Listener Feedback

  • London Scala Users Group
    • http://www.meetup.com/london-scala/

    • Last year's: http://2009.geecon.org
  • ESDC Conference
    • http://www.go-esdc.com/
  • Atlanta DevNexus 2010 Conference - AJUG
    • http://www.devnexus.com/

item.title: Java Posse #292 - Roundup 09 - Automated Testing and Refactoring
item.description:
Automated Testing and Refactoring

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com

Recorded at the Java Posse Roundup 2009 in Crested Butte, CO. A Discussion about the automated generation of tests, and code refactoring.

Please, join us for the next Java Posse Roundup, March 16th to 19th in Crested Butte, CO, with a free JVM languages day on the 15th.

To find out more:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/

To sign up:
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/register.php

And if you do sign up, please give us a little more information about yourself (like your T-shirt size - hint hint) at:
http://tinyurl.com/jproundup2010
  • XUnit/JUnit
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XUnit
    • http://www.junit.org/
  • Integration testing
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integration_testing
  • Code coverage
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_coverage
  • Static analysis, Findbugs, PMD, etc.
    • http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/
    • http://pmd.sourceforge.net/

    • http://www.atlassian.com/software/clover/tour/

    • http://www.jfrog.org/products.php

    • http://www.jmock.org/
    • http://easymock.org/
  • JMeter
    • http://jakarta.apache.org/jmeter/

    • http://www.theserverside.com/tt/knowledgecenter/knowledgecenter.tss?l=ConcurrencyTestingJavaApps

    • http://seleniumhq.org/
  • Silk
    • http://www.borland.com/us/products/silk/silktest/index.html

    • https://wiki.mozilla.org/Testopia
  • IMVU multi-user chat
    • http://imvu.com/
  • SLF4J - Simple Logging for Java
    • http://www.slf4j.org/
